Package com.ninjaguild.dragoneggdrop.dragon

Class DragonTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ninjaguild.dragoneggdrop.dragon.DragonTemplate
  • public class DragonTemplate
extends Object
    Represents a template for a custom dragon to be spawned containing information about its name, the style of its boss bar, as well as the loot it will drop after it is killed.
    Author:
    Parker Hawke - 2008Choco

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • DragonTemplate

        public DragonTemplate​(File file,
                      String name,
                      org.bukkit.boss.BarStyle barStyle,
                      org.bukkit.boss.BarColor barColour)
        Construct a new DragonTemplate object.
        Parameters:
        file - the file holding this template data
        name - the name of the dragon. Can be null
        barStyle - the style of the bar. Can be null
        barColour - the colour of the bar. Can be null

      • DragonTemplate

        public DragonTemplate​(String identifier,
                      String name,
                      org.bukkit.boss.BarStyle barStyle,
                      org.bukkit.boss.BarColor barColour)
        Construct a new DragonTemplate object.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the name to identify this template
        name - the name of the dragon. Can be null
        barStyle - the style of the bar. Can be null
        barColour - the colour of the bar. Can be null

    • Method Detail

      • getIdentifier

        public String getIdentifier()
        Get the string that identifies this template. If a file was passed as a parameter in the creation of this template, the file's name will be used as the identifier.
        Returns:
        the unique template identifier

      • getAttributeValue

        public double getAttributeValue​(org.bukkit.attribute.Attribute attribute)
        Get the value to be applied for a specific attribute. If the provided attribute value is not specified, -1 will be returned.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to check
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute, or -1 if non existent

        Returns:
